subject: AccuWeather.com Alert(tm) Advisory  (avcavc)
body:
AccuWeather.com Alert[TM]






















 







							Severe Watches and Warnings for BEVERLY HILLS 













LOXCFWLOX
WHUS46 KLOX 260649 CCA
CFWLOX

COASTAL HAZARD MESSAGE...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOS ANGELES/OXNARD CA
1148 PM PDT WED APR 25 2007

..HIGH SURF EXPECTED ON EXPOSED WEST FACING SHORES...

HIGH SURF WILL CONTINUE AND STRONG RIP CURRENTS WILL PERSIST
THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON ALONG EXPOSED WEST FACING SHORES. THIS
LARGE NORTHWEST SWELL WILL BRING THE HIGHEST SURF CONDITIONS TO
THE COASTAL AREAS OF SAN LUIS OBISPO AND WESTERN SANTA BARBARA
COUNTIES. DUE TO THE LONGER PERIOD OF THE SWELL...SOME OF THIS
ENERGY WILL SPREAD INTO THE INNER COASTAL WATERS...RESULTING IN
HIGHER THAN NORMAL SURF CONDITIONS ACROSS WEST FACING BEACHES OF
LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES.

CAZ046-260800-
/O.COR.KLOX.CF.S.0006.000000T0000Z-070426T2200Z/
SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS RECREATIONAL AREA-
1148 PM PDT WED APR 25 2007

HIGHER THAN NORMAL SURF FOR THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS WAS
INCLUDED IN ERROR IN THE LAST ISSUANCE. NO SURF IS EXPECTED FOR
THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS.

$$

CAZ034-035-261515-
/O.CON.KLOX.SU.Y.0007.000000T0000Z-070426T2200Z/
SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
SANTA BARBARA COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
1148 PM PDT WED APR 25 2007

..HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT THURSDAY...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LOS ANGELES/OXNARD HAS CONTINUED A
HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR THE SAN LUIS OBISPO AND SANTA BARBARA
COUNTY CENTRAL COASTS. THIS ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM
PDT THURSDAY.

BREAKERS BETWEEN 10 AND 13 FEET WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY
AFTERNOON...WITH HIGHEST SURF CONDITIONS ON WEST AND NORTHWEST
FACING BEACHES.

A HIGH SURF ADVISORY MEANS THAT HIGH SURF WILL AFFECT BEACHES IN THE
ADVISORY AREA...PRODUCING STRONG RIP CURRENTS AND LOCALIZED BEACH
EROSION. ALL PERSONS SHOULD BE AWARE OF THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH
WATER RELATED ACTIVITIES AND USE EXTREME CAUTION WHEN ENTERING THE
OCEAN. WHEN IN DOUBT...JUST STAY OUT.

$$

CAZ040-041-261515-
/O.CON.KLOX.CF.S.0006.000000T0000Z-070426T2200Z/
VENTURA COUNTY COAST-
LOS ANGELES COUNTY COAST INCLUDING DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES-
1148 PM PDT WED APR 25 2007

..HIGHER THAN NORMAL SURF EXPECTED TO CONTINUE...

HIGHER THAN NORMAL SURF EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT THE LOS ANGELES AND
VENTURA COUNTY BEACHES THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON. BREAKERS
BETWEEN 4 AND 6 FEET WILL BE COMMON ACROSS WEST FACING BEACHES OF
LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON...WITH
LOCALLY HIGHER SETS LIKELY ACROSS WELL EXPOSED AREAS.

THE HIGHER THAN NORMAL SURF CONDITIONS WILL LIKELY PRODUCE STRONG
RIP CURRENTS. ALL PERSONS SHOULD BE AWARE OF THE RISKS ASSOCIATED
WITH WATER RELATED ACTIVITIES AND USE EXTREME CAUTION WHEN ENTERING
THE OCEAN. WHEN IN DOUBT...JUST STAY OUT.

$$

HALL
